intro: Stilpnopappus bicolor, commonly known as the yellow globe mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has hairy, glandular leaves and produces small, spherical fruits that are covered in soft, white pappus hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Stilpnopappus bicolor is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton.
